title: The Solid Blue Cube
description: Create a basic 'div' element with a solid blue background (#3b82f6) and dimensions of 6rem by 6rem.

title: The Padded Red Banner
description: Construct a 'p' element containing the text "Hello World". The element must have a red background (#ef4444), 1rem of padding on all sides, and the text must be horizontally centered.
codeblocks: Hello World

title: Click & Confirm
description: Arrange a 'button' element and a 'span' element next to each other on the same line. The button should say "Click Me" and the span should contain the text "Done!". Include a space between them.

title: The Sunny Frame
description: Create an empty 'div' with a fixed size of 100px by 100px. The element must be outlined by a solid 2px yellow border (#facc15).

title: The Wrapper Structure
description: Structure two 'div' elements, with the inner one containing the text "Inner Content". The outer 'div' must have an attribute 'id' set to "wrapper".

title: The Sunset Swipe
description: Create an empty 'div' that is 200px wide and 50px tall. Give it a background that fades diagonally (from 45Â° angle) from a light green (#d9f99d) to a dark blue (#1e3a8a).

title: The Input Companion
description: Create an 'input' element of type 'checkbox'. Immediately preceding it, place a 'label' element with the text "Accept Terms". The label must be associated with the input using the 'for' and 'id' attributes (use "terms" for both).

title: The Ghost Button
description: Create a 'button' element with the text "Submit". Style it to have a transparent background, a solid 1px black border, and 0.5rem of padding.
codeblocks:
<button 
	style={
		background-color: transparent;
		border: 1px solid black;
		padding: 0.5rem;
	} 
>Submit</button>

title: The Philosopher's Whisper
description: Use a 'blockquote' element to contain the text "Keep moving forward.". Give this block a 3rem margin on the left side and align the text inside to the right.
codeblocks: Keep moving forward.

title: Shopping List Shenanigans
description: Create an unordered list (<ul>) containing three list items (<li>) with the text: "Apples", "Bananas", and "Carrots".

title: The Emerald Glow
description: Create an empty 'div' with 80px width and height. Apply a subtle green box shadow (#10b981) that is offset 0px and has a 5px blur radius.

title: Mandatory Mailing
description: Create an 'input' field of type 'email'. The field must include the 'required' attribute (no value needed) to indicate that it must be filled out before form submission.

title: The Direct Link
description: Create an 'a' (anchor) element. The link should navigate to 'https://example.com' and display the text "Visit Example".

title: Emphasis on the Emphasis
description: Create a paragraph tag ('p') containing the text "Important Info". Make the word "Important" bold using the <strong> tag, and make the word "Info" italic using the <em> tag.

title: Stuck to the Corner
description: Create an empty 'div' that is 50px wide and tall. Set its position to 'fixed' so it stays put, and place it exactly 10px from the top and 10px from the right edge of the viewport.

title: The Accessible Picture
description: Create an element. Set its source ('src') to 'image.jpg' and provide essential alternative text ('alt') as "A placeholder image". The element should be self-closing.

title: The Giant Heading
description: Create an <h2> element with the text "Big Title". Apply a style to set the font size to 3em (three times the default font size).

title: Unclickable Status
description: Create an 'input' element of type 'text'. It must have a placeholder of "Cannot Edit" and be permanently disabled so the user cannot interact with it.

title: The Citrus Line
description: Create a 'span' element containing the text "Attention!". Style the text to have an orange underline (#f97316) that is solid and 2px thick.

title: The Divider
description: Create a simple, self-closing horizontal rule (<hr>) element to visually separate content.

title: The Outer Monologue
description: Create an outer 'div' element. Inside it, place a 'p' element containing the text "Inside the box.".

title: The Step-by-Step
description: Create an ordered list (<ol>) containing two list items (<li>) with the text: "First Step" and "Second Step".

title: The Faint Print
description: Create a 'p' element containing the text "Fine Print". Apply a style to set the text color to a light gray (#9ca3af).

title: Just a Box
description: Create an empty 'div' element with a 'class' attribute set to "container".

title: The Blank Slate
description: Create a 'textarea' element for multiline user input. Set its number of columns ('cols') to 30 and rows ('rows') to 5.

title: Link That Goes Nowhere
description: Create an anchor tag ('a') with the text "Dead Link". The link must have an 'href' attribute that points to '#' (fragment identifier) and a 'role' attribute set to "button".

title: The Feature Announcement
description: Create an <h3> element containing the text "New Feature!".

title: The Absolute Center
description: Create an outer 'div' and an inner 'div'. The outer container must use Flexbox to perfectly center the inner container both horizontally and vertically. The inner box should be 50px by 50px with a purple background (#a855f7).

title: The Wall-to-Wall Text
description: Create a 'p' element containing the text "I fill my parent!". Set the element's width to 100% of its available space (like a w-full utility class).

title: The Backwards Duo
description: Create a container 'div' using Flexbox. Inside, place two paragraphs: "First Item" (give it id="A") and "Second Item" (give it id="B"). Use CSS order properties to make the Second Item appear first in the layout.
codeblocks:
First Item

Second Item

title: The Simple Split
description: Create a container 'div' that uses CSS Grid. Configure the grid to have two equal-width columns. Inside, place two empty 'div' children with class names 'col-1' and 'col-2'.

title: The Squished Spacing
description: Create two separate 'p' elements. Give the first one the text "Top Text" and a 20px bottom margin. Give the second one the text "Bottom Text" and a 30px top margin. (The challenge is about correct structure, knowing margin collapse will happen is a bonus).
codeblocks:
Top Text

Bottom Text

title: The Hidden Element
description: Create a 'div' element containing the text "Only visible on small screens.". Apply a style to ensure the element is hidden (i.e., display: none) unless a specific media query is applied (though only the initial display: none style is required here).
codeblocks: Only visible on small screens.

title: Full-Block Click
description: Create an anchor tag ('a') with the text "Click Area". Use CSS to force the link to behave like a block-level element, taking up the full width available.

title: Spaced-Out Siblings
description: Create a Flex container 'div'. Place two empty 'span' children inside. Use the CSS 'gap' property (set to 1rem) on the parent to ensure there is spacing between the children without needing margins.

title: The Overlap Game
description: Create two empty 'div's, one red (#ef4444) and one blue (#3b82f6). Both must have 50px dimensions and a position: absolute. Use z-index to make the red box stack above the blue box.

title: Classified Heading
description: Create an <h1> element with the text "Main Title". Assign it a class attribute of "title-large".
